title: Spider GAN: Leveraging Friendly Neighbors to Accelerate GAN Training. (arXiv:2305.07613v1 [cs.CV])
abstract: Training Generative adversarial networks (GANs) stably is a challenging task. The generator in GANs transform noise vectors, typically Gaussian distributed, into realistic data such as images. In this paper, we propose a novel approach for training GANs with images as inputs, but without enforcing any pairwise constraints. The intuition is that images are more structured than noise, which the generator can leverage to learn a more robust transformation. The process can be made efficient by identifying closely related datasets, or a ``friendly neighborhood'' of the target distribution, inspiring the moniker, Spider GAN. To define friendly neighborhoods leveraging proximity between datasets, we propose a new measure called the signed inception distance (SID), inspired by the polyharmonic kernel. We show that the Spider GAN formulation results in faster convergence, as the generator can discover correspondence even between seemingly unrelated datasets, for instance, between Tiny-ImageNet

translated_title: Spider GAN:利用友好邻居加速GAN训练
translated_abstract: GAN的训练是个有挑战性的任务，本文提出了Spider GAN方法，该方法利用图像结构的特点优化生成器的转换，通过定义一种新的度量方式，即有符号启动距离（SID），使其更高效地寻找友好邻居，结果导致更快的收敛，即使在看似不相关的数据集之间也可以找到对应关系。
tldr: 本文提出了一种名为Spider GAN的新方法，通过寻找数据集之间的友好邻居来提高GAN的训练效率，加速收敛，即使是不相关的数据集之间也可以发现对应关系。
en_tdlr: This paper proposes a novel approach called Spider GAN, which uses the structure of images to optimize the generator's transformation and improves the efficiency of GAN training by identifying friendly neighborhoods between datasets, resulting in faster convergence, even between seemingly unrelated datasets.
